body.name: CUCRAF Blackout Curtains 108 inches Long, Room Darkening Window Curtain Panels, Rod Pocket Thermal Insulated Solid Drapes for Bedroom Living Room, 52x108 inch, Black, Set of 2 Panels
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: ROOM DARKENOING & PROTECT PRIVACY: These blackout curtains made of three-layer innovative textured fabric, durable, smooth and can block out 85% -95% light and UV rays, effectively protect your sleep health and privacy.

THERMAL INSULATED & ENERGR SAVING: The blackout window curtain panels provide reasonable insulation from some heat and noise, and the insulation also helps keep the room cool in the summer and warm in the winter. Provide you with a more comfortable life experience.

BASIC INFORMATION: Package includes 2 panels of blackout rod pocket curtains , each curtain panel measures 52 inches wide and 108 inches long, available in a variety of stylish colors. Rod pocket style fits most standard curtain rod of 1.5 inches in diameter and works smoothly，which makes the curtains easy to install and slide.

QUALITY WORKMANSHIP & WIDE APPLICATION: To bring superior quality and great consumer experience for you, each curtain is hand sewn by experienced workers. Suitable for bedroom, living room, kitchen, office, TV room ,etc, whether it is home decor or holiday decoration.

MACHINE WASHABLE & EASY MAINTANCE: Rod pocket curtains can be washed in a cold gentle cycle. Triple-woven textured fabric will not be ruined after washing.Iron on low setting as needed. Do not bleach. Tumble dry low.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: CUCRAF Rod Pocket Room Darkening Blackout Curtains Attractive, impressive room-dimming performance and premium materials for superior quality and a superior consumer experience.

Comes in a variety of colors. Rod Pocket look nice and make hanging them easy. Insulated curtains that block out most sunlight. Reasonable light and noise filtering insulation. Washes nicely.Quality curtains can make the difference between getting a good night's sleep and waking at sunrise courtesy of the sun’s early rays. Suitable for bedroom, living room, kitchen, office, TV room ,etc, whether it is home decor or holiday decoration.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well made, keeps light and wind out. Room is noticeably warmer requiring less heat. I bought them last year but waited till this winter to put them up. Blackout function is excellent - my first time using this type of curtain.They do look really nice , seams are perfect. They will accommodate wider windows . Ours are just standard size. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are a steal! Feel expensive! They also do an amazing job not letting any light in. The fabric itself has a really cool texture, not cheap at all. Soft, smooth, and is a true deep rich black color. Amazing buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally found the right size.
reviews.reviewText: The window we are using these in was hard to find a covering for. These are about an inch or so shy of the window but they fit into the window frame perfectly so no awkward spacing.Quality and look are good, they don’t look cheap, price was great.Recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was surprised by the quality of this product for the price. The curtains are very opaque, with a soft buttery feel. They don’t have the rubberized thermal layer that can get stuck to the window, which is nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are very nice and they definitely keep the light out. I am very happy with these curtains and would definitely order from this seller again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are a great deal, really nice product but too wide for us
reviews.reviewText: I got these in dark gray, 52x72. I've had a TON of blackout curtains and these are the best deal in my opinion if they work for you, although they aren't quite as effective as more expensive curtains. They do let in little pinpoints of light but this is fine for us. These curtains are very thick, btw. And the sewing and construction are very nice.Unfortunately these don't work in our space even though they're great.We have Eclipse blackout wraparound double rods, so we can have blackout curtains under regular curtains that are more our style. The thing is the rods are pretty close to each other, maybe 1" apart? So when you push these curtains to the side of the rod, they bunch up and fill the entire space between rods. That makes it harder to push the curtains apart, and they slowly slide back toward the middle when you stop pushing. It's a ton of work to slide these open if you use the rod pocket, and you have to stand in the exact right spot (or on a ladder) to be able to get them to slide to the side. If you use the rod pocket you probably wouldn't want to open and close these every day. We want them open in the day so we're using curtain rings to make them work better, but that changes the length of the curtains and makes you want to mount the rod higher up.We don't have a lot of room on the sides of our windows to mount the curtain rod brackets further apart so we can't push the curtains all the way to the side either when we use the rod pockets. The curtains cover a big portion of the window. It's super frustrating.Anyway, using curtain rings allows the curtains to slide easily with minimal force, and to slide fully to one side or the other without covering any of the window.I didn't realize how to choose the best size of blackout curtains for our application. When I have the blackout curtains shut I want them to be relatively flat, especially because the curtain rings make the top less stable and let more light in when there's extra fabric. Also, when the curtains are pushed to the sides, I want them to fold up narrow enough to disappear behind the front curtains. Just as an example, we have one window that's about 52" wide, with the rod brackets mounted a few inches outside each side of the window. So for 52", we need a total curtain width of up to about 62" to fully cover the window, with no gaps and minimal bunching/slack to keep light out and look nice. These curtains are 52" wide and there are two, so that's 104" of curtain width, a few feet wider than needed. The width on these is great, especially at this price (most sellers cut corners on the width because people often don't notice). But it's just way too wide for our windows. I thought wider meant more coverage lol but it's not the case for our setup.Anyway I wanted to mention this hoping it would save other people some time. We have the wrong color of rings so we have to buy more curtain rings and narrower curtains. Also again, having to hang the curtain on rings means you may need a different length or may need to install the rod higher up. The rings allow more light if you don't plan ahead, because they lower the top edge of the curtain closer to the window.If you want to be able to easily slide these fully to the side every day, and minimize light, you may want to:* Use curtain rings (that match the rod 😅)* Include the length of the rings when you're planning (get the right curtain length and mount the rod at the right height for the length of curtain AND rings, or plan to hem)* Install the rod at the correct height for the length of your panel AND the rings, with enough room at the top to minimize light spilling out* Buy the correct width of curtain. If you want them flat when they're closed, to minimize light, you may need narrower panels than you think (don't just buy the standard width because that's what you usually get)It's not this manufacturer's fault at all but the process of figuring this out has been extremely frustrating. I've put so many holes in the wall and gone through at least 10 sets of curtains in the past several years, plus multiple rod sets. So hopefully this helps someone lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful heavyweight curtains that don't "feel" like blackout drapes
reviews.reviewText: I ordered these curtains to use with a ceiling mounted curtain track as a room divider, so I wanted darkening drapes that looked good from both sides, and these are perfect. The curtain clips are the small kind that attach to the top and the pole pocket works great, without too much fabric there to make it hard for the tiny clips to hold securely.We have tall ceilings, and these almost touch the floor but move easily and stack back well. I have 2 pair in use together, and the only limitation in collecting them at the wall is the width of the hardware itself, the curtains (4 panels) could probably be contained within less that 12 inches of space.The fabric is nice and soft, heavy weight without feeling too stiff. Would definitely buy again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely dark enough, very nice colour
reviews.reviewText: I opened them to make sure the colour was what I expected and found them to be exactly what I wanted. They are on the long side so I hope raising the rod up the wall will help.
Happy with the curtains would recommend
